thinking.disposable_income: Lincoln Park is an affluent area with median household income of $134,277 and 61.3% of households earning over $100,000. This suggests residents have significant disposable income and can absorb moderate increases in transportation costs
thinking.discretionary_consumption: With high per capita income ($109,538), residents likely have substantial discretionary spending. A higher sales tax would impact this but may be tolerable given the wealth levels. Annual consumption is likely high, making sales tax impact notable
thinking.accessibility: The area has high transit usage (33.4%) and low car dependency (32.3% no vehicle, 47.8% one vehicle). Good mix of transportation modes with significant walk/bike share (9.3%). This suggests strong transit infrastructure and multiple viable transportation options
thinking.decision_rationale: 1. Prioritized proposals that improve transit times while keeping fares moderate, given high transit usage. 2. Considered that higher driver fees are acceptable as most households have 0-1 cars and many use alternative modes. 3. Moderate sales tax increase acceptable given high incomes. 4. Balanced time savings with cost increases, knowing community can absorb some cost increase. 5. Favored proposals that reduce car travel times to benefit the 27% who drive alone
